title: Part A
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that the actions that maximize the combined profits are for Patrick’s Pie to “Advertise” and for Dee’s Pizzeria to “Stay Out.”
The response states that the actions that maximize the combined profits are for Patrick’s Pie to “Advertise” and for Dee’s Pizzeria to “Stay Out.”

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

The response must use numbers from the payoff matrix in the explanation in order to receive the point.
descriptions: The response does not state that neither firm has an incentive to cheat and/or does not explain that Dee’s Pizzeria’s profits would decrease from $0 to –$2 if Dee’s Pizzeria cheated and Patrick’s Pie’s profits would decrease from $175 to $100 if Patrick’s Pie cheated.

The response states that neither firm has an incentive to cheat and explains that Dee’s Pizzeria’s profits would decrease from $0 to –$2 if Dee’s Pizzeria cheated and Patrick’s Pie’s profits would decrease from $175 to $100 if Patrick’s Pie cheated.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that Patrick’s Pie does not have a dominant strategy.
The response states that Patrick’s Pie does not have a dominant strategy.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not state the two Nash equilibria below:

- Patrick’s Pie “Do Not Advertise” and Dee’s Pizzeria “Enter”

- Patrick’s Pie “Advertise” and Dee’s Pizzeria “Stay Out”

The response states the two Nash equilibria below:

- Patrick’s Pie “Do Not Advertise” and Dee’s Pizzeria “Enter”

- Patrick’s Pie “Advertise” and Dee’s Pizzeria “Stay Out”

title: Part E
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does neither of the following.

· Redraws the payoff matrix shows the effect of the side payment on the payoffs when Dee’s Pizzeria stays out.

· States that the Nash equilibrium is for Patrick’s Pie to “Advertise” and for Dee’s Pizzeria to “Stay Out.”
The response does one of the following.
The response does both of the following.
